cs3524.mud

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs3524.mud.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MUD, java.rmi.Remote

    public class World
extends java.lang.Object
implements MUD
    The implementation of a world with locations, paths and players.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new world with a given name.

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the world.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface MUD

      • generateMap

        public void generateMap(java.lang.String filename)
        Generates a map for the world. This method requires a file, which map definitions in the specified format. Based on the input, a number of locations is generated. These locations are then connected through paths.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file containing the map

      • placeItems

        public void placeItems(java.lang.String filename)
        Populates the map with items. This method requires a file, which contains item definitions and their respective locations.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file containing the items

      • isUniquePlayerName

        public boolean isUniquePlayerName(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: MUD
        Checks if a name is already used by a player in an MUD. Since, players are identified within an MUD by their names, every player has to have a unique name.
        Specified by:
        isUniquePlayerName in interface MUD
        Parameters:
        name - the name to be checked for uniqueness

      • oppositeTo

        public static Direction oppositeTo(Direction d)
        A helper method to define directions opposite to each other. Used by the map generator to create paths in both directions, since a world map is represented by an undirected graph.
